DataElement.preferredName: Genital Biospecimen Collection At Patient Visit And Testing Human Papillomavirus Patient Consent Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/NA indicator for whether the participant agrees that their genital samples can be collected at Study Visits and they may be used for detecting HPV.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Genital Biospecimen Collection At Patient Visit And Testing Human Papillomavirus Patient Consent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The group of organs and glands involved with having a child. In women, these are the uterus (womb), the fallopian tubes, the ovaries, and the vagina (birth canal). The reproductive system in men includes the testes, the prostate, and the penis._The act or process of gathering biospecimens for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes._Used to indicate position, location, or state._A visit by a patient or study participant to a medical professional._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._A procedure for critical evaluation._A strain of papillomavirus that can infect the skin and mucous membranes of humans._A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: The group of organs and glands involved with having a child. In women, these are the uterus (womb), the fallopian tubes, the ovaries, and the vagina (birth canal). The reproductive system in men includes the testes, the prostate, and the penis.
The act or process of gathering biospecimens for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes.
Used to indicate position, location, or state.
A visit by a patient or study participant to a medical professional.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Did the male participant agre
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the male participant agree to provide self-collected genital samples at the indicated study visits and agree that they may be used for detecting HPV in their body?
